Uses of Class
co2api.ContractException

    • Uses of ContractException in co2api

      Methods in co2api that throw ContractException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Public<T> Public.accept()
      This method must be used for accept a contract published on the web (in the contract server).
      java.lang.Boolean Session.amICulpable()
      Checks if you are definitively culpable in your contract.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.amIOnDuty()
      Checks if you are on duty during the interaction with the counterparty.
      TST TST.dualOf()
      Returns the dual of this TST or throws an exception if the contract does not admit a compliant.
      java.lang.Integer Message.getIntegerValue()
      Returns the Integer value.
      java.lang.Long CO2ServerConnection.getServerTime()
      Returns the server current time (currently it doesn't consider the network latency).
      Session<T> Public.getSession()
      A non-blocking API that if the contract is fused returns a Session object for further operations, like send and receive.
      java.lang.String Message.getStringValue()
      Returns the String value.
      java.lang.Boolean TST.isCompliantWith(TST other)
      Allows to check if this TST contract is compliant with another given TST.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.isEnded()
      Checks if the session that involves a given contract is ended.
      java.lang.Boolean Public.isFused()
      Use this method for checking if a previously published contract is already fused (with another) or not.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.isSuccess()
      Checks if the session that involves a given contract is ended with success (respect to the calling participant).
      Message Session.receive()
      Allows to receive the value sended by the other participant, when it was performing its action.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.send(java.lang.String action)
      It allows to perform an action, without passing a value to the counterparty.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.send(java.lang.String action, java.lang.Integer value)
      It allows to perform an action, passing a value to the counterparty.
      java.lang.Boolean Session.send(java.lang.String action, java.lang.String value)
      It allows to perform an action, passing a value to the counterparty.
      void ContractModel.setFromString(java.lang.String contract)
      The contract must have a string syntax that the middleare can check
      void TST.setFromString(java.lang.String contract)
      Builds a new TST by using a string representation
      void ContractModel.setFromXML(ContractXML contractXml)
      The contract must have a XML syntax that the middleare can check
      void TST.setFromXML(ContractXML contractXml)
      Builds a new TST by using a ContractXML object
      Public<T> Private.tell()
      Tells this Private contract to the middleware
      Message Session.waitForReceive()
      A blocking API that stops your application until you don't receive any message by the counterparty.
      Session<T> Public.waitForSession()
      A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started.
      Session<T> Public.waitForSession(java.lang.Integer msecs)
      A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started: you can specify a maximum time for wait.
      boolean Session.waitUntilOnDuty()
      A blocking API that stops your application until it's your turn to perform an action.
      boolean Session.waitUntilOnDuty(java.lang.Integer msecs)
      A blocking API that stops your application until it's your turn to perform an action: you can specify a maximum time for wait.
      Constructors in co2api that throw ContractException 
      Constructor and Description
      CO2ServerConnection(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new connection with the main middleware (at co2.unica.it).
      CO2ServerConnection(java.lang.String server, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new connection with the middleware at the specified server address.
      TST(ContractXML contractXml)
      Builds a new TST by using a ContractXML object
      TST(java.lang.String contract)
      Builds a new TST by using a string representation
